snippet: The European unit of General Motors said it hoped the facility in Bochum, in the Ruhr region, could be used for distribution of components and so avoid layoffs.
abstract: Opel, unprofitable European unit of General Motors, says it will stop producing cars at its plant in Bochum, German, in 2016; says it hopes facility can be used for distribution of components and so avoid layoffs.
lead_paragraph: The European unit of General Motors said it hoped the facility in Bochum, in the Ruhr region, could be used for distribution of components and so avoid layoffs.

headline.main: Opel Confirms End of Car Production at a Key German Plant
headline.print_headline: To Contain Losses, Opel Announces It Will Close a German Plant
